title: Four relatives from same family plunge to death at dam while posing for selfie
text:

Four members of the same family died after falling from a dam while posing for a selfie in India.

The victims were among a group of six people holding hands as they stood above the Pamdar dam in the southern state of Tamil Nadu in India on Sunday, police said.

When one of the group slipped, everyone was dragged over the edge.

Newlywed V Nivedha, 20, tragically died alongside Sneha, 22, Kanniga, 20 and Santosh, 14, who was the first to slip into the water, according to local police.

Her husband, G Perumalsamy, 25, who was taking the picture, survived and managed to save his 15-year-old sister Yuvarani.

The other four people disappeared underwater.

The Hindu reports that V Nivedha and G Perumalsamy, both from Bargur in Krishnagiri, got married last month.

They were visiting a relative in the town of Uthangarai when the incident happened.

Their bodies were later recovered and sent to Uthangarai Government hospital for post-mortem examinations.

S Prabhakar, a senior police official from the district of Krishnagiri, told CNN : "They wanted to take a selfie at this spot on the dam and they slipped.

"The water level increased while they were there."

Researchers from the All India Institute of Medical Sciences found that about half of the 259 selfie-related deaths and accidents reported in the world between 2011 and 2017 occurred in India.

Other countries with high numbers of selfie-related deaths are Russia, the United States and Pakistan, ABC News reports.
description: V Nivedha, 20, had recently tied the knot with G Perumalsamy, 25, when she died alongside four family members
